Posts.Content: Cathy2 wrote: I just saw this on Fightn F 8's blog. Thursday, December 29, 2011 Prayer for Lorelei God is here and now, an ever present source of comfort and peace. God is with Lorelei radiating peace and serenity in this moment of consciousness. We pray this prayer of gratitude for the life of Lorelei as the days hasten toward her next experience. We rest in the knowledge of a loving God and a compassionate Universe that enfolds us and soothes us during this precious time of transition and transformation. Be at peace, knowing that all is well. Reflect on her rich and abundant life, and give thanks. Bring to mind those that she loves, and be appreciative. We pray for a gentle releasing and letting go. We pray for a loving and joyous merging of her soul with the pure essence of His love. We know that she is always connected to those she loves and she looks forward to the new relationship we will someday enjoy when this life, as we know it now, is concluded. With a thankful heart and a willing Spirit, help us to lean into this experience. This is the cycle of life and of all good. God is near. God is here. In Jesus’ name we pray. Amen. Diagnosis 3/17/11, IDC stage IV, mets, ER+/ PR- HER - Log in to post a reply

Posts.Title: Help Cathy2 cookie97

Posts.Content: Cathy2 wrote: Hello I am new to this group. I was just diagnosed 3/17 with IDC, 2.7 cent mass in left breast stage IV. It has progressively gone down hill with bad news, pet scan revealed numerous bone mets and 2 nodules in lower right lung. I go Tuesday to meet with Onc to discuss plan of chemo drugs and start chemo on 4/1. I am so scared and trying to reach out to find someone with these same mets. What is prognosis? I can not believe that I was feeling fine 2 weeks ago while all the time walking around with cancer having a party in my body!  I pray that chemo takes to my body as well! God Bless each of you and wish me well on my journey. Diagnosis 3/17/11, IDC stage IV, mets, ER+/ PR- HER - Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Help Cathy2 cookie97

Posts.Content: Apr 21, 2011 06:50AM Cathy2 wrote: I am still not the person I used to be. I can not seem to get past this cancer thing! I am so sad all the time. I am able to go to work everday but can hardly wait to come home! I cry everyday and wondered if it was from the Femara but onc said no. My family and friends try to keep me focused on the good but my stupid mind always goes back to the dark side. I have only started with Femara and Zometa and had no chemo yet! My bones are hurting and I am now having to take pain pills every 4 hours while awake. I do not want to do anything but sit or sleep! My poor family! I feel like I'm already gone! I have a 27 year old daughter I want to see marry and have children someday, I also still have a 13 year old son that I want to at least see graduate high school! Why am I already throwing in the towel? Why am I such a baby? I feel like I need someone to hold my hand all the time?  Sorry for the doom and gloom!

Posts.Content: Cathy2 wrote: Had a great weekend, our daugther Casey got married! Thought I would post a couple of pictures. Didn't think of cancer at all until it was past my normal 9:00 bedtime..haha! Reception lasted till 11:00 and my feet (neuropathy) and back were killing me. So thankful to still be here and getting to see this! Now if I can live to see my youngest son (14) graduate high school and my just married daugthter have a baby!  Please cancer slow down...I need 4 more years! First picture is me, third picture is my granddaughters...sorry I don't know how to make pictures smaller. Diagnosis 3/17/11, IDC stage IV, mets, ER+/ PR- HER - Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Aug 25, 2011 09:53PM Cathy2 wrote:
Posts.Title: The stable boy has left me :( jenn3 sincitydealer

Posts.Content: Cathy2 wrote: Dang I didn't get a very long ride with Taxol! I was on Carbo/Taxol for six months...put me in remission. Had Pet scan in November, breast and lung mets gone!  Bone mets for the most part were gone too, I only had a slight tic of one in left femur. Great news for the holidays..remission! Onc removed me from the Carbo and for the last three months I only received Taxol and Zometa. Well two weeks ago I felt the lump in my breast and she ordered Pet. Got results yesterday and as I guessed the monster is back in my breast/axillary,  lung nodule increased from 4mm to 9mm. I also have a mass in mediastinal! Only slight progression in bones. Not the news we ever want to get! My onc wants to try Avastin next if approved by insurance. She said we use it now or will be unable to down the line. No chemo for me yesterday which has put me in a panic...hopefully something will start next week. I picture the cancer having a grand party inside my body! My Dr also wanted to re-biopsy my breast and make sure my receptors are correct (first biopsy not done where I'm going now) they put me in a program which will test for my bio-markers and provide more detail. This will help in treament choices and it was at no cost. Went yesterday for biopsy. I am hoping for a change in my receptors because my ER+ is only 7% and she looks at me as a triple negative! This is not good!  Wow am I lucky or what? I am not only Stage IV out the gate but triple neg too!  I am feeling really down today and feel like I'm loosing this battle! Posts.Content: Cathy2 wrote: Had a great weekend, our daugther Casey got married! Thought I would post a couple of pictures. Didn't think of cancer at all until it was past my normal 9:00 bedtime..haha! Reception lasted till 11:00 and my feet (neuropathy) and back were killing me. So thankful to still be here and getting to see this! Now if I can live to see my youngest son (14) graduate high school and my just married daugthter have a baby!  Please cancer slow down...I need 4 more years! First picture is me, third picture is my granddaughters...sorry I don't know how to make pictures smaller. Diagnosis 3/17/11, IDC stage IV, mets, ER+/ PR- HER - Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Jun 17, 2012 08:02PM Cathy2 wrote: I did Carbo/Taxol for 6 months. The Carbo made me very tired! My Onc only wanted me to have Carbo for 6 months so she stopped it and continued only with Taxol. The Taxol only did not work and cancer was active again in February. I am now on Avastin/Taxol and should find out in the next week or so if it's working. I feel great so I hope to get good news. Fivealive I hope your doctor started you on the winning chemo!

Posts.Title: my o my apple Iwillwinthisbattle

Posts.Content: Cathy2 wrote: I don't understand this whole cancer game yet, but is it really normal to be on chemo indefinitely? I just started round 7 of Taxol, had 6 rounds of Carbo/Taxol with great results. I am in remission even though I have one small spot on left femur and spec in lung. My labs are picture perfect and my tumor markers continue to go down. I thought with such great results I could try a hormonal. I trust my Onc completely and do not want  her to think I doubt course. She talked like we could dial back the strength and or take breaks but I am so freaking tired! I seriously have sat in the recliner in my robe and gown for the last three days. I only got out for church and am in bed by 8:00! I hate having no hair, eyebrows or eyelashes. I have no other SE's other than slight neuropathy and if this worsens tx would change. I guess my question is, has anyone else been on chemo for extended periods of time? Do they continue with this chemo until progression only to move to another chemo? Diagnosis 3/17/11, IDC stage IV, mets, ER+/ PR- HER - Log in to post a reply
